item.title: Manager, Data Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Data Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Data Analytics Manager will assist Internal Audit RBC US teams in the research, development, and delivery of strategic and analytics initiatives to achieve Audit objectives in alignment with Internal Audit’s transformation goals.  These initiatives affect operations and audit execution across multiple geographies and/or across multiple business units/platforms. 

What will you do?

  • Responsible for supporting the performance and quality of analytics that will provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned for the respective platforms.
  • Support the business phases of the analytics lifecycle for the respective Internal Audit platform(s). 
  • Responsible for assisting in internal and external research, stakeholder management, collaborative requirement gathering, and a user-centric approach that in combination ensure technical solutions are both valuable and readily adopted across Internal Audit. 
  • Effectively collaborate closely with technical talent pools who transform proposed business cases into leading edge technological solutions. 
  • Strategically recommend and apply existing technology to reduce duplication of efforts and ensure the Internal Audit platforms have the skills and capacity to use and understand the technology available across Internal Audit.
  • Responsible for researching and developing foundational analytics that support Internal Audit RBC US teams.
  • Create and maintain foundational data & analytics initiatives that provide continuous improvements of the audits that have been planned in the platform(s).
  • Support effective delivery of a pipeline of data analytics and automation initiatives that impact Audit execution activities globally across all regions and lines of business.
  • Support the prioritization of analytics based on areas of best return; deciding on accept/decline analytics and automation activities for the Lab to execute on; hosting regular cadence with lab stakeholders; ensuring analytics initiatives are tracked in central repository.
  • Acts as a peer to the Data Engineers and Data Scientists in the centralized Data Management & Analytics team (DMA).
  • Empowered to challenge and refine the value of analytics ideas as proposed by the auditors
  • Conduct research and identify opportunities for improving processes and technology: Externally, research best practices, emerging risks, and innovation across RBC and broadly throughout the financial sector. Internally, gather, understand, and analyse auditors’ pain points.
  • Size potential upside of deploying a solution across platforms, in line with your findings. In partnership with technical experts and other stakeholders, define and articulate ROI for your business cases for Executive Selection Committee approval.
  • Support technical builds and process reengineering aligned with business cases at every step of analytics lifecycle; engage auditors as needed and support user acceptance testing across your platforms.
  • Support the communication of ongoing work to broad Internal Audit audience and support creation of training materials and experiences for selected tools.
  • Support the adoption of centrally developed data products in the platform with support from the DMA team and global adoption of IA wide data initiatives.
  • Support technology use and reuse by having a thorough understanding of available and upcoming technology across the Internal Audit toolkit.
  • Assist in review of quarterly Audit plan for existing tool use to reduce duplication of efforts and to ensure technology provides expected return.
  • Support gathering and triage feedback for technical experts on an ongoing basis
  • Mentor team members - assist with individual capability building and certification, grow the skillsets /capabilities of the team, transfer skills/knowledge, and demonstrate awareness of linkages and political forces.
  • Develop and maintain strong working relationships with team members, process stakeholders, support groups, business partner teams, to ensure collaboration and cooperation to meet timing of projects.
  • Continually demonstrate commitment to and application of RBC Leadership Model Behaviors

What do you need to succeed?

  • Bachelor’s Degree; Masters or Advanced Degree preferred
  • Knowledge of financial industry regulatory guidelines
  • Proficient in auditing principles and techniques
  • Proficient written and oral communication skills
  • Proficient in project management
  • Good understanding of programming languages (Python, SQL, R)
  • Strong understanding and experience using data visualization tools
  • A strong understanding of Data Analytics to optimize use
  • Ability to learn new and emerging technologies
  • Ability to work in a dynamically changing environment.
  • Proven ability to produce, conduct, and report on internal and external research, including qualitative and quantitative metrics
  • Demonstrated ability to calculate ROI for projects of various complexity and scale
  • Working knowledge of Python, SQL, Data Visualization, UX/UI
  • Strong knowledge of Agile or other lean methodologies
  • Strong knowledge of design, development, and implementation experience utilizing data technologies
  • Proficient analytical and problem-solving skills
  • Strong data profiling, cleaning, and mining
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders
  • Expert data extract, transform, and load processes with a variety of data types
  • 2+ years of experience with big data technologies – Hadoop (Pig, Hive), noSQL/SQL databases, parallel processing techniques and Apache Spark
  • Strong interpersonal and communication skills: Ability to explain complex Audit and Technological concepts to various stakeholders ranging from Specialists to Executives
  • Strong aptitude for Collaboration, Stakeholder Management and Relationship Management
  • Domain Knowledge and capacity to research and effectively understand innovative concepts, including but not limited to Emerging Financial Risk and Regulation, Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, UX/UI, and Data Visualization

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $110,000 - $190,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

  • Drives RBC’s high performance culture
  • Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals
  • Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

Work hours/week:

40

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Internal Audit

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-11-16-08:00

Application Deadline:

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.
​​​​​​​
We also strive to provide an accessible candidate experience for our prospective employees with different abilities. Please let us know if you need any accommodations during the recruitment process.

item.title: Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Our team is the Digital Intelligence Group.  We are here to help RBC build best-in-class digital products, optimize client experience, and drive business outcomes through improved use of analytics.

In this role of Senior Manager, Data Insight Analytics, you will provide leadership and support in using analytics, including advanced analytics and statistical models, to generate actionable insights, automate business actions, and improve the speed and quality of decisions across Digital teams at RBC.

You will work with Digital Channels and Products for personal and business clients including Mobile, Online Banking, Direct Investing, NOMI and RBC Rewards.  You will structure, curate and complete analyses, develop net new data assets and model data that will enable data-driven decisions.

What do you need to succeed? 

Must-have

  • BA/BSc or above in mathematics, economics, statistics, computer science or related quantitative field
  • 7+ years\' experience in related digital product development, marketing analyst or data mining role
  • Advanced experience with Python or Scala, Google Analytics, Tableau, Data Studio and PowerPoint
  • Hands-on knowledge of advanced digital analytics methodologies such as experimentation and testing, competitive analysis, surveys and market research
  • Success with building out an analysis end-to-end with a high degree of independence: i.e., perform lead requirements gathering, develop an analysis plan, wrangle data to suit the problem, apply the right type of analytics and package the output into a presentable deliverable
  • Storytelling and executive presence: ability to articulate a narrative for an analysis or report
  • Experience working on agile teams using Github and JIRA
  • Ability to work with and lead analysts and managers

Nice-to-have

  • MA, MSc or PhD in a quantitative field
  • Strong understanding of AWS Big Data services such as Amazon S3, EMR and Glue
  • Knowledge and experience in areas of data modeling, data orchestration and data pipeline 

What will you do?

  • Insights and Analytics:
    • Help advance a culture of timely data-driven decisions
    • Implement practical applications of analytical and statistical frameworks and methodologies to client and prospect data sets to study demographics, behaviors, and business outcomes
    • Use a variety of analytical methods (descriptive, diagnostic and predictive) such as time series analysis, segmentation, hypothesis testing and causal inference to surface actionable insights
    • Embed reliable and re-usable patterns and showcase them to drive forward the analytics brand of the Digital Intelligence Group both internally and across Digital teams at RBC

  • Data Collection/Ingestions/Acquisition:
    • Collaborate with data developers, DevOps, data engineers and cloud engineers to implement new data collection/ingestion/acquisition
    • Support business stakeholders in identifying needs for additional data acquisitions, and coordinate plans to orchestrate data acquisitions
    • Develop templates and systems for repeatable processes
  • Digital Product Reporting and Presentations:
    • Define, communicate and enforce reporting and analytics standards, policies and data governance
    • Construct presentations in story format and deliver them to partners across the organization 
    • Deliver clear, concise and timely reports identifying trends, issues and opportunities 
  • Stakeholder Consultancy:
    • Manage relationships with key business stakeholders to develop, execute and monitor complex insights and analytical solutions to business problems
    • Digest complex problems and organize into achievable milestones
    • Apply expertise and think creatively to address unique or ambiguous situations and to find solutions to problems that can be complex and non-routine 

What’s in it for you?

  • We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.
  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • A world-class training program in financial services
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Personal and Commercial Banking

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Manager, Analytics & Insights

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The PSI (Personal Savings & Investments) Strategy & Analytics team collaborates with all Mutual Fund Distribution, GIC & Savings and Direct Investing product owners to support the creation and evolution of cross PSI LOB strategies.

In this role, you are responsible for generating, translating, and supporting world class product insights that enhance RBC’s client experience, drive business results, and increase loyalty to all PSI products.  You will serve as the primary business liaison to PSI LOBs for data, analytics and insights.  By establishing strong collaborative relationships with leaders across the LOBs, you will support and deliver business insights that drive results for the PSI platform.

What will you do?

 Drive all LOB’s critical business imperatives to unlock growth and develop client’s product loyalty to RBC

  • Work with the Sr. Director and LOB leads to leverage product and client insights that impact and influence the delivery of business strategies and tactics and to balance near, mid, and long-term business growth
  • Work closely with internal clients to support their product analytics requirements in order to ensure the delivery of timely, and relevant Insights that are aligned against critical business imperatives
  • Support the alignment of analytics across PSI to improve efficiency in strategic insights and maximize LOBs growth potential
  • Support the definition and adoption of key platform-focused client centric business strategies and tactics including: Client Acquisition & Onboarding; Activation & Cross Sell; Reactivation & Retention strategies
  • Data and Reporting Capability Development (Tools, processes, procedures)
  • Drive continuous improvement to PSI reporting tools, processes, policies, and procedures
  • Provide thought leadership across the organization in representing the added value of enhanced PSI client knowledge and product insights in delivering sustainable differentiation and business results

 What do you need to succeed? 

 Must-have:

  • A strategic business analytics professional with 4+ years of progressively responsible experience in customer or product insights and analytics.
  • Ability to lead implementation of product strategies by providing analytical and reporting support focused on data analysis & financial impact
  • Data mining skills using SAS, SQL, R, or Python; solid technical skill set including the creation and delivery of customer analytics, research and profitability results into business outcomes
  • Strong critical thinking; demonstrated ability to leverage product insights to draw meaningful conclusions and recommendations; balances the art and science.
  • An experienced project manager and facilitator who can effectively bring together internal stakeholders in a way that will result in innovative new ideas.

Nice-to-have

  • Familiar with online tools such as Google Analytics Premium and Tableau
  • Advanced knowledge of R, Python, SQL or SAS
  • Ability to code in Scala, JavaScript, JQuery, HTML and related languages an asset
  • Previous work experience using cloud computing environments (AWS, Google Cloud, Azure) an asset

What’s in it for you?

 We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities         

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Canada

Full time

Personal and Commercial Banking

item.title: Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Developer - TM1 / Planning Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a member of EPM team and a dynamic group of technical specialists, The job involves leading the development, design, configuring and support of the financial models in line with industry best practices while collaborating with Business stakeholders and extended Finance teams. EPM technical specialists focuses on providing enterprise class design and solutions in the space of planning, budgeting, forecasting, allocations and financial consolidation to their finance partners.

What will you do?

  • Drive Implementation and lead development and technical efforts for EPM using IBM Suite of products.
  • Design innovative solution using best practices and customizing for the business specific needs.
  • Make the granular design decisions around acquiring, loading data, coding principles.
  • Be a hands-on SME advising, implementing, testing and training.
  • Communicate timely and accurate updates on the various initiatives, update on any risks following the set protocols.
  • Collaborate. You will work closely with internal and external contacts to ensure we are delivering a robust solutions meeting client’s specifications.
  • Mentor. You will support and mentor the developers and support teams.
  • Develops, codes, documents and executes unit test, system, integration and acceptance test for functions of high complexity.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-Have:

  • Developer experience in any one of the toolsets like IBM Planning Analytics / TM1, Anaplan, Oracle Hyperion, SAP BPC
  • Strong coding experience, development background with experience in solution and designing.
  • Programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Visual Basic and Java
  • Ability to extract, transform, and load data with a variety of data types. Skills in any ETL toolsets.
  • Ability to perform complex data analysis on large volumes of data and present findings to stakeholders

Nice-to-have:

  • Integration experience on SAAS products.
  • Strong Proficiency with Excel, Building complex models & macros in excel

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities

item.title: 2023 Summer Student, Global Risk Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 Summer Student, Global Risk Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Global Risk Analytics (GRA) is the center of expertise for models used in risk measurement of market and counterparty credit risk for trading book. Given the increasing importance of assessing the financial impacts of climate change to financial institutions, GRA is also building expertise in climate risk analytics to support RBC’s various climate risk stress testing and scenario analysis mandates (e.g., CCAR in US, ICAAP in UK).

In particular, GRA has model development ownership for several regional climate risk scenario analysis models, covering both transition risk (posed to clients in transition to low-carbon economy) and physical risk (posed by acute weather events) for different asset classes (e.g., corporate bond, municipal bonds, real estate, and wholesale loans).  The team is also developing machine-learning models to assess the TCFD (Task Force on Climate-Related Financial Disclosures) and sustainability reports by clients in different industry sectors.

Climate risk analytics is an emerging field. Institutions around the world (e.g., regulators, banks, vendors, etc.) are grappling with the challenges in how to enhance the data, scenario design, and methodology. At this stage, GRA is currently developing a unified platform to onboard different “climate risk + machine learning” modules, and potentially utilizing open-source data (if deemed appropriate) for research purposes.

GRA is seeking an individual who is interested in applying data analytics and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching open-source data platforms for climate risk, and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications. The candidate will learn data analytics and machine learning with applications in climate risk.

What will you do?

  • Assist to research open-source data and analytics platforms, such as OS-Climate, Oasis, Climate Analytics CIE, WRI Aqueduct, World Bank CCKP.
  • Identify use cases of the open-source platforms.
  • Assist to design and implement Python-based tools for climate risk related applications.
  • Make presentation to senior people in risk

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Strong programming experience in Python and SQL.
  • Knowledge about machine learning, data analytics, and data visualization
  • Ability to communicate technical matters in written and oral forms
  • Team players to collaborate and innovate

Nice-to-have

  • Interest in learning about emerging data and techniques to assess climate risk impact.
  • Understand of the big picture regarding how risk function works in banks
  • Knowledge of financial products in trading book and banking book.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

Apply data analytics and programming skills to empower our climate risk analytics capability. The intern student will be involved in researching open-source data platforms for climate risk and developing Python-based tools for climate risk related analytics and machine learning applications.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Group Risk Management

Job Type:

Student/Coop (Fixed Term)

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-12-12-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-15-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. item.title: Director - Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Director - Corporate Deposits Pricing & Analytics

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

Reporting to the Head of Revenue Management, you will be responsible for developing a competitive and sustainable pricing approach for USCM’s term deposits, demand deposits and current account in the mid-market corporate space, leading the execution of be-spoke and real-time pricing for large amount of corporate deposits in close partnership with relationship managers, sales and money market desk, poviding input to the overall pricing strategy focused on revenues across clients, deposits and other products at the total portfolio level and recommending pricing strategies that help shape client, product and tenor mix to achieve a stable operational deposit base over time 

US Cash Management USCM) Business is a unique opportunity to build the cash management business of the future from the ground up. This is an exciting time to join a start-up function within RBC, built from scratch and anchored in a technical/digital play vs. a traditional play, enabling RBC to compete with new entrants in this space!

What will you do?

  • Develop, set and monitor Client and Product level pricing for term deposits, demand deposits and current account

  • Leading the execution of be-spoke and real-time pricing for large amount of corporate deposits in close partnership with relationship managers, sales and money market desk

  • Stay current of market and competitive research on pricing practices for corporate deposits pricing

  • Turn data-driven insights into recommendations that help shape client, product and tenor mix to achieve a stable operational deposit base over time 

  • Liaison with Treasury to launch hedging programs from a pricing perspective and to identify drivers of funds transfer pricing rate changes

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Selects, builds, and leads a high performing deposits pricing team, leveraging individual capabilities and strengths

  • Provides coaching, mentoring and professional development that further embeds the right culture, values, and leadership behaviors

  • Works with team members to establish goals, drive performance management, support career development and reward strong performance.

  • Ability to forge strong relationships and routines with cross functional partners to drive strong business outcomes  

  • Excellent partnership and communication with other RBC sales channels (i.e. Global Markets, P&CB BFS and CNB) as there is a potential for client overlap 

  • Ability to negotiate with both internal and external stakeholders, including clients, on deposits pricing related topics 

What do you need to succeed?

  • Graduate degree in a related field

  • Subject matter expert in liquidity value, rate beta quantification and funds transfer pricing of deposits

  • Fluent with deposits product offerings and competitive pricing in the target market

  • Good grasp of asset liability management and balance sheet hedging (Treasury / fixed income portfolio management experience is preferred)

  • Solid understanding of derivatives and tractor/bond ladder in relation to deposits hedging

  • High degree of business and financial acumen 

  • Able to perform data-driven analytics including the synthesis of complex data into meaningful insights

  • Able to work with x-functional teams and functional partners to design an efficient process architecture that adheres to all RBC policies and controls.

  • Must be able to lead under stress for team’s prompt delivery of bespoke and real-time pricing for large amount of corporate deposits

  • Strong communication skills with ability to communicate complex messages, trade-offs and tell a compelling story

  • Have rigorous attention to detail with the ability to grasp big picture

  • Comfortable working with quick turnaround times and deadlines

  • Ability to drive innovation and continuous process improvement of the team

Preferred

  • Experience working in transaction banking at another FI 

  • US Cash Management experience 

  • Experience leading or shaping large transformational efforts preferred

  • Professional designation (CFA/FRM/MBA) and/or Master in quantitative fields is highly desirable

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

item.title: 2023 Summer Student, Data Analyst, RBCx Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 Summer Student, Data Analyst, RBCx Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

  • RBC is reimagining the role we play in our clients’ lives. We are creating dedicated teams which will operate in a startup like environment separate from the core banking business. We are hiring a Co-op student for the Fall 2022 term (September – December) to join the RBCx Analytics team. As part of the RBCx Analytics team you will work directly work with one of RBC’s greatest assets, data. The Analytics team works closely with each Venture to help use data to imagine new ideas, measure success and collaborate to solve big problems. If you love to learn, be constantly challenged, grow your capabilities in business and data analytics this is the role for you! 

What will you do?

  • Work closely with Venture teams to help drive toward measures of success and answering big questions
  • Develop and maintain internal relationships
  • Support monthly reporting and work to automate reporting processes
  • Analyze RBC, Venture and digital data to map the customer journey

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • An ability to work independently and within a team
  • A willingness to learn and continually grow
  • Experience working with and manipulating data in excel
  • Solid understanding and technical skills in data analytics methodologies
  • Basic SQL capabilities
  • Experience in / an interest in learning advanced analytics methodologies and tools (Python, R, machine learning, etc.)

Nice-to-have

  • University degree or courses in a quantitative field of study (e.g. mathematics, engineering, economics, statistics) to demonstrate ability for critical thinking & numerical analysis
  • An ability to tell stories with data
  • Communication and presentation skills
  • Experience in data visualization tools including Tableau
  • Experience with digital analytics tools

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to influence decision making that can make a difference and have a lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic environment with new startups that go beyond banking

Job Summary

RBC is reimagining the role we play in our clients’ lives. We are creating dedicated teams which will operate in a startup like environment separate from the core banking business. We are hiring a Co-op student for the Fall 2022 term (September – December) to join the RBCx Analytics team. As part of the RBCx Analytics team, you will work directly work with one of RBC’s greatest assets, data. The team works closely with each Venture to help use data to imagine new ideas, measure success and collaborate to solve big problems. If you love to learn, be constantly challenged, grow your capabilities in business and data analytics this is the role for you!

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.description:

2023 Summer Global Asset Management, 4 months, Analytics Engineer Co-op

  • The hired student will be participating in and helping the Advanced Analytics team with enhancing our machine learning platform.
  • Work will include developing, deploying, and maintaining data pipelines as well as building out our workflow framework to further the quality of our data assets and streamline the creation and delivery of said assets to end business users (such as marketing and sales).
  • Involved in developing and delivering key feature contributions to our in-house Python library as well as our overall backend MLOps and dataflow architecture -- all of which will both leverage and help further develop the student\'s software development and data engineering skills.

  • Documenting processes or upgrading existing procedure manuals.
  • Developing product or service knowledge and competence in tools and business processes used in the department.

item.title: P&CB Finance, International Banking Platform PM & CB Cost Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

P&CB Finance, International Banking Platform PM & CB Cost Analytics

Job Description

Primary Responsibilities

  • Platform lead coordinating with the Caribbean and US Banking businesses.  Responsible for reviewing results and forecasts of these regions, driving deeper insights and oversight.

  • Lead the annual refresh of the cost allocation process, collaborating with a range of partners including Financial Advisors, the Enterprise Efficiency team, as well as Canadian Banking business.

  • Developing the P&CB Flash. This document provides a summary of analysis on Canadian Banking, US Banking and Caribbean Banking that is done each month and distributed to senior executives including the CFO, CB head and their Operating Committee.

  • Act as center of expertise for technology and functional support costs for Canadian Banking, including investigating and improving the transparency of support costs– technology & operations, functions, occupancy, fraud/sundry losses and cross-platform

  • Provide insights and transparency for certain centralized expense lines such as capital taxes, deposit insurance premium, fraud and sundry losses

  • Act as the Platform Perform Management lead working with business and functional partners on initiative tracking, forecasting for Application Development spend; oversight over related capitalization and depreciation entries.

Must Have:

  • Accounting or other professional designation

  • Good written & verbal communication

  • Strong interpersonal and relationship management

  • Strong business, finance & accounting knowledge

  • Excellent analytical thinking

  • Proficient with MS Excel, especially for modeling

  • Attention to detail & works with minimal instruction

  • Comfortable dealing with incomplete information

  • Ability to work under pressure, focus on priorities & multi-task

Nice to Have:

  • Knowledge of EPM and RBC Finance tools & processes

Authorities, Impact, Risk

  • Key liaison to platform-level advisory and strategic analysis

  • Key liaison to Financial Advisors and other staff with CB Finance

  • Key liaison to Global Functions and T&O Finance teams.

  • Key liaison to Caribbean and US Banking Finance teams.

  • Key liaison to Enterprise Efficiency team with respect to annual NIE allocation refresh.

  • Authority to revise, streamline or otherwise enhance management reporting processes related to internal technology and functional support costs.

Key Relationships

  • This position would interact with all key members of the P&CB Platform Performance Management team, including Caribbean and US Banking

  • Financial Advisors & other staff within CB Finance

  • Global Functions and T&O Finance teams

  • Enterprise Efficiency

  • PMO team within Canadian Banking

Working Conditions

  • Work involving extensive computer use requiring little physical effort

  • Deliver accurate results under high pressure and tight timelines Fast-paced environment with multiple demands and will generate high stress levels

Time Allocation

  • Monthly Reporting & analysis of NIE and P&CB Flash (25%)

  • Caribbean and US Banking (25%)

  • Forecasting & planning (25%)

  • Annual NIE allocation refresh process (15%)

  • Personal development & other projects (10%)

Job Summary

As Senior Manager P&CB NIE and International Banking, you are the Finance Lead responsible for overseeing over $2 billion in technology & functional support and occupancy costs for Canadian banking as well as being the key Finance lead in Platform for driving insights for the Caribbean and US Banking businesses. You will also lead the annual refresh process driving revised NIE allocations for Canadian Banking. The Senior Manager will provide business executives and senior management of P&CB insights and actionable information for effectively understanding trends across International Banking and controlling Indirect cost growth.

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Office of the CFO

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2022-12-07-08:00

Application Deadline:

2023-01-03-08:00

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we embrace diversity and inclusion for innovation and growth. We are committed to building inclusive teams and an equitable workplace for our employees to bring their true selves to work. We are taking actions to tackle issues of inequity and systemic bias to support our diverse talent, clients and communities.

item.title: 2023 Summer Student - Risk Analyst, Risk Modeling and Analytics
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

2023 Summer Student - Risk Analyst, Risk Modeling and Analytics

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

Analyst, Risk Modeling and Analytics

What will you do?

  • Gain knowledge on retail banking and fundamental risk management principals, including the specifics of retail products, enterprise data systems and credit risk management.
  • Support the team’s feature generation project including data extraction, transformation and dealing with data quality issues. Work with large, enterprise level datasets leveraging standardized RBC tools such as Python, SAS and SQL.
  • Support regular and ad-hoc reporting and data analytics, and become comfortable communicating and dealing with senior members of the Risk Modeling team.
  • Assist with preparing documentation for audits or other processes.

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Desire to learn and an eagerness to make a meaningful contribution to the team environment at RBC Risk Modeling and Analytics.
  • Experience in SAS/R/Python or other mathematical / statistical programming languages.
  • Experience with SQL/Teradata or other database management systems.
  • Ability to handle and organize large amounts of data and effectively summarize / present it to other stakeholders.

Nice-to-have

  • Knowledge of basic concepts in credit risk (PD, LGD, EAD) and financial data.
  • Good understanding of banking, finance and statistics / calculus

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work and make a difference
  • Opportunities to building close relationships

Job Summary

Participates in and supports the operational activities of a business unit. Applies experience and complete working knowledge of the job and policies/practices to perform a combination of routine tasks and varied administrative/operational assignments.
